ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Regular EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: LOL in a way that s nice to hear! At least I won t be running around all by myself! Ha ha ha! I think for me even if I could run EQ2 I would play EQ1 at least
ygData.messageBody:
LOL in a way that's nice to hear! At least I won't be running around all
by myself! Ha ha ha!

I think for me even if I could run EQ2 I would play EQ1 at least for a
while. I have invested to much time into my toons. I've been playing a
little over 2 years now off and on (RL issues playing into that) and
granted the highest lvl I have is a 32 Ranger. It's just that I have so
many things to do yet within the game, places to go, things to see,
monsters to kill, (Equstrielle, you will die!) trade skills to master
and much more.

Yes, I've noticed a lot of guild activity as of late in EQ1. New ones
forming, old ones either folding, merging with others, and lots of
recruiting. Our guild, (Mystic Crusaders), is surviving the fallout of
EQ2 so far. It's funny and a slightly odd feeling at the same time, but
there seems to be only 3 maybe 4 of us still actively playing EQ1 and
when I log in it's just so quiet. A little eerie at times. I've been
actively recruiting so hopefully we will rebuild soon.

As for EQ2, beautiful graphics. That's about all I can say. I haven't
actually played the game so I'm not sure what game play is like.
Although one thing I've heard about and I kind of wish they would
include in EQ1 is the conning system. Now I guess instead of the little
color ring, you also get icons either above or below the NPC name that
shows exactly how tough they may be. Also if you have a mob and you
target one it shows you ALL the others that will come running if you attack.

Happy adventuring!
Durgaa; Ranger of the 32nd Season on Solusek Ro Server and member of
Mystic Crusaders

http://www.mysticcrusaders.org
